intro: Jainia, commonly known as the Indian bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to the Himalayas and other regions of South Asia. The plants typically have showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue or purple. They are often found in alpine or subalpine environments, growing in rocky or well-drained soils. Jainia species are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens for their aesthetic beauty.
